sections.heading: VETERANS ACT 2012
sections.content: VETERANS ACT 2012

An Act to establish the National Veterans Council, to provide for the 
registration of veterans and veterans associations, and to provide for 
matters connected therewith.
ENACTED by the Parliament of Malaysia as follows:

sections.heading: PART I
sections.content: PART I

sections.heading: PRELIMINARY
sections.content: PRELIMINARY
Short title and commencement

sections.heading: 1.  (1)  This Act may be cited as the Veterans Act 2012.
sections.content: 1.  (1)  This Act may be cited as the Veterans Act 2012.

(2)  This Act comes into operation on a date to be appointed by the 
Minister by notification in the Gazette.
Interpretation

sections.heading: 2.  In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—
sections.content: 2.  In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—
“veteran activity”” includes the following activities:
(a)  organizing any welfare and socioeconomic programs for
veterans and their dependants;
(b)  organizing  any  campaign  in  relation  to  the  interests  of
veterans and their dependants;
6                                     Laws of Malaysia                            ACT 740
(d)  organizing  any  appreciation  and  acknowledgement
programs for veterans;
(e)  organizing or promoting any awareness programs for the
interest and benefit of veterans; and
“Department” means the Malaysian Armed Forces Veterans Affairs
Department;
“Council” means the National Veterans Council;
“Minister”  means  the  Minister  charged  with  the  responsibility  for
defence;
“Registrar” means the Registrar appointed under section 7;

“association” means  any organization, society, association, club or 
body consisting of at least fifty percent membership amongst former 
members  of  the  Malaysian  Armed  Forces  or  the  Commonwealth 
Forces who have served in Malaysia;
“veterans  association”  means  any  association  which  is  registered
under this Act;

“veteran” means a Malaysian citizen who has served full time and 
has  not  been  retired  or  discharged  from  service  on  grounds  of 
misconduct in any of the following Forces:
(a)  regular forces of the Malaysian Armed Forces;
(b)  volunteer  forces  mobilized  full  time  by  the  Malaysian
Armed Forces regardless of length of service;
(c)  Force 136;
Veterans                                                    7
(d)  British  Forces  who  served  in  Malaya,  Malaysia  or
Singapore; and
(e)  Sarawak Rangers.

sections.heading: PART II
sections.content: PART II

sections.heading:
ESTABLISHMENT AND FUNCTIONS OF THE NATIONAL 
VETERANS COUNCIL
sections.content:
ESTABLISHMENT AND FUNCTIONS OF THE NATIONAL 
VETERANS COUNCIL
National Veterans Council

sections.heading:
3.  (1)  A body to be known as the National Veterans Council shall 
be established for the purpose of this Act.
sections.content:
3.  (1)  A body to be known as the National Veterans Council shall 
be established for the purpose of this Act.
(2)    The Council shall consist of the following members:
(a)  the Minister who shall be the Chairman;
(b)  the Secretary General of the Ministry of Defence who shall
be the Deputy Chairman;

(c)  the  Director  General  of  the  Malaysian  Armed  Forces 
Veterans Affairs Department who shall be the Secretary;
(d)  the  Assistant  Chief  of  Staff  (Personnel  Services)  of  the
Malaysian Armed Forces Headquarters; and

(e)  not more than five persons, at least two of them are veterans 
who have the experience, knowledge or expertise in matters 
relating to veterans’ affairs to be appointed by the Minister.

(3)  A  member  of  the  Council  appointed  under  paragraph  (2)(e) 
shall, unless he sooner resigns or vacates his office or his appointment 
is sooner revoked, hold office for a term not exceeding two years and 
is eligible for reappointment for a term not exceeding two consecutive 
terms.
Functions of the Council

sections.heading: 4.   (1)  The functions of the Council are as follows:
sections.content: 4.   (1)  The functions of the Council are as follows:
8                                     Laws of Malaysia                            ACT 740
(a)  to  formulate  policies  and  plans  of  action  relating  to
veterans’ affairs;
(b)  to  oversee  the  implementation  of  policies  and  plans  of
action relating to veterans’ affairs;

(c)  to coordinate and monitor the implementation of policies 
and plans of action relating to veterans with the relevant 
ministries, government agencies, bodies or organizations 
and the private sector;

(e)  to advise the Government on the issues of veterans’ affairs 
including the developments at the international level;

to act as the monitoring body for all veterans associations 
in Malaysia; and
(g)  to perform any other functions as directed by the Minister
for the proper implementation of this Act.

(2)      The  Council  shall  have  power  to  do  all  things  expedient  or 
reasonably  necessary  for,  or  incidental  to,  the  performance  of  its 
functions.
(3)    The Council shall regulate its own proceedings.
Allowances

sections.heading:
5.  The members of the Council appointed in subsection 3(2) may be 
paid such allowances as the Minister may determine.
sections.content:
5.  The members of the Council appointed in subsection 3(2) may be 
paid such allowances as the Minister may determine.
Council to be assisted by the Department

sections.heading:
6.  The  Council  shall  be  assisted  by  the  Department  in  the 
performance of its functions and the exercise of its powers under this 
Act.
sections.content:
6.  The  Council  shall  be  assisted  by  the  Department  in  the 
performance of its functions and the exercise of its powers under this 
Act.

sections.content:

Register of veterans

sections.heading:
8.  (1)  The Registrar shall keep and maintain or cause to be kept and 
maintained a register of veterans in such manner and form as may be 
prescribed.
sections.content:
8.  (1)  The Registrar shall keep and maintain or cause to be kept and 
maintained a register of veterans in such manner and form as may be 
prescribed.

(2)  Any register of veterans kept and maintained by the Ministry 
of Defence  and the Department  immediately before the coming into 
operation of this Act shall, on the coming into operation of this Act, be 
deemed to be registers kept and maintained under subsection (1) and 
shall be deemed to form part of such register of veterans.
Application for registration

sections.heading:
9.  (1)  An application for registration as a veteran shall be made in 
writing to the Registrar.
sections.content:
9.  (1)  An application for registration as a veteran shall be made in 
writing to the Registrar.
(2)  Every  application under subsection (1) shall be  accompanied
by such document or information as may be prescribed.

Power  of  Registrar  to  require  applicant  to  provide  additional 
document or information

10. 
(1)  The  Registrar  may,  in  relation  to  any  application  made 
under  section  9,  require  the  applicant  to  provide  such  additional 
document or information within the time as may be specified by the 
Registrar.
10                                     Laws of Malaysia                            ACT 740

(2)  Where the applicant fails to provide the additional document or 
information required by the Registrar under subsection (1) within the 
specified  time  or  any  extended  time  as  may  be  specified  by  the 
Registrar, the application is deemed to have been withdrawn and shall 
not be proceeded with by the Registrar, but without prejudice to a fresh 
application being made by the applicant.
Registration or refusal to register

sections.heading:
11. 
(1)  After  considering  an  application  under  section  9  and  any 
additional  document  or  information  provided  under  section  10,  the 
Registrar may approve or refuse the application.
sections.content:
11. 
(1)  After  considering  an  application  under  section  9  and  any 
additional  document  or  information  provided  under  section  10,  the 
Registrar may approve or refuse the application.

(2)  Where the application is approved, the Registrar shall register 
the applicant by entering the applicant’s particulars in the register of 
veterans referred to in section 8.
(3)  Where the application is refused, the applicant may appeal to
the Minister whose decision shall be final.

(4)  Notwithstanding  subsection  (1),  and  sections  9  and  10,  any 
person who immediately before the coming into operation of this Act 
is  registered  as  a  veteran  with  the  Jabatan  Arah  Rekod  dan  Pencen 
Markas Angkatan Tentera Malaysia shall, on the coming into operation 
of this Act, be deemed to be a veteran registered under this Act.
Issuance of Veteran Card
(1)  The Registrar shall issue to a person who is registered as a

sections.content:

veteran under section 11 a Veteran Card.

(2)  The  Veteran  Card  issued  under  subsection  (1)  shall  be 
conclusive  evidence  for  all  purposes  that  the  person  has  been  duly 
registered as a veteran under this Act.

(3)  Any person to whom a Kad Bekas Tentera has been issued by 
the  Jabatan  Arah  Rekod  dan  Pencen  Markas  Angkatan  Tentera 
Malaysia immediately before the coming into operation of this Act and

sections.content: ASSOCIATIONS

(1)  No association shall carry out any veteran activity unless it

(2)  An association which intends to carry out any veteran activity 
shall  apply  to  the  Registrar  for  registration  under  this  Act  in  such 
manner and form as may be prescribed.
(3)  The  Registrar  may  require  the  applicant  to  provide  any
document or information as may be prescribed.
Registration of veterans association

sections.heading:
14.    (1)  After  considering  an  application  by  an  association  under 
section  13,  the  Registrar  may  approve  or  refuse  the  application  for 
registration.
sections.content:
14.    (1)  After  considering  an  application  by  an  association  under 
section  13,  the  Registrar  may  approve  or  refuse  the  application  for 
registration.

(2)  Without  prejudice  to  the  generality  of  subsection  (1),  if  the 
Registrar  is  satisfied  that  such  association  is  a  non-political 
organization for the advancement of the welfare of veterans and that 
the  constitution  of  such  association  contains  provisions  for  such 
matters  as  set  out  in  the  Schedule,  the  Registrar  shall  approve  the 
registration of such association as a veterans association under this Act.
Register of veterans associations

sections.heading:
15.    (1)  Where  the  application  for  registration  is  approved  by  the 
Registrar, he shall register the association as a veterans association in
sections.content:
15.    (1)  Where  the  application  for  registration  is  approved  by  the 
Registrar, he shall register the association as a veterans association in
12                                     Laws of Malaysia                            ACT 740

the register of veterans associations to be kept and maintained by the 
Registrar in such manner and form as may be prescribed.

(2)  The  Registrar  may  impose  any  conditions,  including  the 
payment  of  any  fees,  as  he  deems  fit  upon  the  registered  veterans 
association.

(3)  A  veterans  association  registered  under  this  Act  shall,  if  its 
constitution does not contain the matters set out in the Schedule, amend 
its constitution within twenty-one days after its registration to include 
such matters.
Certificate of registration

(1)  The  Registrar  shall  issue  to  a  veterans  association 
16. 
registered under section 15 a certificate of registration in the prescribed 
form.

(2)  A  certificate  of  registration,  unless  proved  to  have  been 
subsequently  revoked,  shall  be  conclusive  evidence  for  all  purposes 
that  the  association  has  been  duly  registered  by  the  Registrar  as  a 
veterans association under this Act.
Association registered under the Societies Act 1966

17.  Any  association  registered  under  the  Societies  Act  1966  
[Act 335] on the date of coming into operation of this Act shall cease 
to  be  registered  under  the  Societies  Act  1966  and  shall  within  three 
months thereof apply to the Registrar to be registered under this Act as 
a  veterans  association  to  carry  out  any  veteran  activity;  and  such 
association  shall  continue  to  operate  as  an  association  until  notified 
otherwise by the Registrar.
Revocation or suspension of registration by Registrar

sections.heading:
18.    (1)  The Registrar may revoke or suspend the registration of a 
veterans  association  if  the  Registrar  is  satisfied  that  such  veterans 
association—
sections.content:
18.    (1)  The Registrar may revoke or suspend the registration of a 
veterans  association  if  the  Registrar  is  satisfied  that  such  veterans 
association—
Veterans                                                    13
(a)  has  been  registered  as  a  result  of  a  fraud,  mistake  or
misrepresentation;
(b)  has failed to comply with any of the conditions imposed
by the Registrar under section 15;
(c)  has  contravened  any  provision  of  this  Act  or  any
regulations made under this Act;

(d)  is  inactive  or  is  no  longer  a  fit  and  proper  entity  to  be 
registered to represent veterans in Malaysia or elsewhere;

(e)  is hindering the advancement of veterans and it is in the 
public interest to revoke or suspend its registration;

(f)  has  failed  or  neglected  to  remedy  any  malpractice, 
misconduct or irregularity on the part of its office-bearers 
or its members within the period specified in the written 
notice given by the Registrar; or
(g)  is

(2)    Before  revoking  or  suspending  the  registration  of  a  veterans 
association  under  subsection  (1),  the  Registrar  shall  give  the 
association  an  opportunity  to  submit  reasons,  if  any,  against  the

Appeal

sections.heading: 19.  (1)  Any association aggrieved by a decision of the Registrar—
sections.content: 19.  (1)  Any association aggrieved by a decision of the Registrar—
(a)  in refusing to register such association;
(b)  in  imposing  conditions  on  the  registration  of  such
association; or
(c)  in  revoking  or  suspending  the  registration  of  such
association,

may, within thirty days from the date of the notification of the decision 
of the Registrar, appeal to the Minister whose decision shall be final.
14                                     Laws of Malaysia                            ACT 740

(2)    Before making any decision under subsection (1), the Minister 
may refer the matter to the Council for its advice.
Directions to continue functions of association

20.  The  Minister  may,  pending  his  decision  on  an  appeal  under 
section  19,  give  any  direction  so  as  to  enable  such  association  to 
continue its functions and may appoint an ad hoc committee to manage 
the affairs of the association for a period not exceeding twelve months.
Internal procedures for resolution of dispute

21.  Every  veterans  association  shall  resolve  any  dispute  arising 
amongst  its  members  or  with  its  committee  or  governing  body  in 
accordance with the internal procedures prescribed in the regulations.
Referral of dispute to Minister

22. 
(1)  Where  a  dispute  cannot  be  resolved  under  the  internal 
procedures  referred  to  in  section  21,  any  aggrieved  member  or  the 
veterans  association  itself  may  refer  the  dispute  to  the  Minister  for 
resolution.

(2)  Notwithstanding  subsection  (1),  the  Minister  may,  upon  the 
advice  of  the  Registrar  or  at  any  time  he  deems  it  necessary  and 
expedient, require any veterans association to refer any dispute to him 
for resolution.

(3)  The decision of the Minister under this section shall be final; 
but the Minister may seek advice of the Council or any other committee 
established  by  the  Minister  for  that  purpose  before  making  his 
decision.
Consequences of refusal, revocation or suspension of registration

sections.heading:
23.    Upon the refusal of the Registrar to register any association under 
section 17 or upon the revocation or suspension of the registration of
sections.content:
23.    Upon the refusal of the Registrar to register any association under 
section 17 or upon the revocation or suspension of the registration of
Veterans                                                    15

any veterans association under this Act, the following provisions shall 
apply:

(a)  such  association  shall  not  organize,  conduct,  sanction  or 
participate  in  any  veteran  activity  or  any  events  or  forum 
relating  to  veterans’  affairs  whether  within  or  outside 
Malaysia; and

(b)  such  association  shall  not  receive  or  continue  to  receive 
funding for veteran activity or any matter in connection with 
the  interest,  affairs  or  welfare  of  veterans  from  the 
Government or any statutory body.

sections.heading: CONSTITUTION OF VETERANS ASSOCIATION
sections.content: CONSTITUTION OF VETERANS ASSOCIATION

The  following  matters  shall  be  provided  in  the  constitution  of  a 
veterans association:

sections.heading: 1.  The association shall have the following aims and objects:
sections.content: 1.  The association shall have the following aims and objects:
(a)  for the advancement of the welfare of the veterans;
(b)  to  maintain good terms  with  and to  be in  good standing
with the Department;
(c)  to ensure that its constitution is observed and abided by all
its members; and
(d)  to  control  and  exercise  jurisdiction  over  all  activities  in
relation to the affairs of veterans.

sections.heading:
2.  Its  activities  are  conducted  without  discrimination  as  to  gender, 
race, religion, social origin, language, political inclination or any other 
opinion held by its members.
sections.content:
2.  Its  activities  are  conducted  without  discrimination  as  to  gender, 
race, religion, social origin, language, political inclination or any other 
opinion held by its members.

sections.heading:
3.  The selection procedures for committee members in the association 
are open and fair.
sections.content:
3.  The selection procedures for committee members in the association 
are open and fair.

sections.heading:
4.  Its fully audited accounts with reports on all its activities and the 
use and disbursement of all its funds for its preceding financial year be
sections.content:
4.  Its fully audited accounts with reports on all its activities and the 
use and disbursement of all its funds for its preceding financial year be
Veterans                                                    17

submitted  to  the  Registrar  together  with  such  other  reports  as  the 
Registrar may require.
